message:
Correctness_Score: 0.2
Style_Score: 0.6
Simplicity_Score: 0.3
Robustness_Score: 0.2
Reasoning: I inspected the solution and attempted to run unit checks, but running the test runner failed in this environment because Python is not available. Statically, the recursive memoized brute-force DP is functionally correct for small N (it will produce the optimal result and would pass the provided samples), but it is exponential in time and memory and will not finish within the problem constraints (N up to 3e5) and will hit Python recursion limits on moderate N. Style is acceptable (brief docstring and clear variable names) but sparse on explanations; the implementation is concise but algorithmically inefficient, and robustness is poor due to lack of safeguards for large inputs and recursion depth/performance issues.
